intro: Microula forrestii, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, greenish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Microula forrestii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in dry gardens.
